newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech shares continue slide led again by high caps.
newsitem.headline: Czech shares continue slide led again by high caps.

text.p: The Czech PX50 index continued to slide in more active trading on Wednesday with heavily capitalised shares again taking the lead as foreign investors pull back in response to uncertainty about the economy.
The PX50 lost 0.65 percent to 546.4 while the major issue dominated RPIX dropped 1.1 percent to 1,100.

The biggest decliner among the blue chips was savings bank Ceska Sporitelna which slipped 3.4 percent to 310 while the country's largest commercial bank Komercni Banka fared little better with a two percent fall to 2,199.
Power utility CEZ continued to slump to levels not seen since early this year. It ended 15 crowns down on the day, precariously positioned on the psychologically important 1,000 mark.
SPT Telecom was the best performer among the PX50's four heavyweights, losing eight crowns to close the day on 3,250.
In the broader market, conference organiser BVV Brno was the biggest loser of the day. dropping 191 crowns to 4,102.
Turnover rose to one billion crowns from just under 700 million on Tuesday.
